channel.title: sillygwailo tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from sillygwailo.

item.description: @ReneeStephen Would you believe there are apps that you can install which will hide hide those? Why yes, it is an arms race.
item.source:markdown: @ReneeStephen Would you believe there are apps that you can install which will hide hide those? Why yes, it is an arms race.

item.description: @VancouverSun The indiscretion! The irresponsibility!
item.source:markdown: @VancouverSun The indiscretion! The irresponsibility!

item.description:
So much for David Eby becoming the next premier of B.C., I assume. https://t.co/vkvKDNO3SP

Maybe he doesn’t actually want the job.

I sometimes catch myself thinking that becoming the leader of a political party is a punishment rather than an achievement.
item.source:markdown:
So much for David Eby becoming the next premier of B.C., I assume. https://t.co/vkvKDNO3SP
Maybe he doesn’t actually want the job.
I sometimes catch myself thinking that becoming the leader of a political party is a punishment rather than an achievement.

item.description:

item.description: Tomorrow, I will mark 15 years of not knowing how to use hashtags. https://t.co/EgxZbtjlJv

item.description:
Owen Wilson Wow https://t.co/VCZyIfH3dQ

I assume he’ll be awarded another Presidential Medal of Freedom, this time with Distinction.
item.source:markdown:
*Owen Wilson Wow* https://t.co/VCZyIfH3dQ
I assume he’ll be awarded another Presidential Medal of Freedom, this time with Distinction.

item.description:
It used to be that you could look on Facebook to see who you knew that was in the town you’re currently in. Now you have to … I don’t know. How does one do that nowadays?

What I’m trying to say is, it’s hard to feel a strong connection to a place if you don’t have any friends who live there.
item.source:markdown:
It used to be that you could look on Facebook to see who you knew that was in the town you’re currently in. Now you have to … I don’t know. How does one do that nowadays?
What I’m trying to say is, it’s hard to feel a strong connection to a place if you don’t have any friends who live there.

item.description: @joshtpm I first saw this with Paul Ryan, and thought it was because he purposely wore suits that didn’t fit him because he thought men who buy suits that don’t fit them would identify with him. https://t.co/BK5oPHB9gD
item.source:markdown: @joshtpm I first saw this with Paul Ryan, and thought it was because he purposely wore suits that didn’t fit him because he thought men who buy suits that don’t fit them would identify with him. https://t.co/BK5oPHB9gD

item.description: @toddsieling Sounds right to me. It came to my mind because a woman running in Toronto, in my ward, did just that, i.e. was a high-profile school trustee and is now running for council. I also thought of the former Vancouver councillor with the initials AR.
item.source:markdown: @toddsieling Sounds right to me. It came to my mind because a woman running in Toronto, in my ward, did just that, i.e. was a high-profile school trustee and is now running for council. I also thought of the former Vancouver councillor with the initials AR.

item.description: @toddsieling Since school boards are often a springboard to council, and they own/manage a lot of real estate, I make sure I know who the trustee for my area is, what they stand for, etc.
item.source:markdown: @toddsieling Since school boards are often a springboard to council, and they own/manage a lot of real estate, I make sure I know who the trustee for my area is, what they stand for, etc.

item.description: @davidpleonard I donated in memory of Teva, whom I didn’t know, but who I know loved and was loved, and in memory of my late mother (ditto). Fuck cancer.

item.description: @PortmanDoe As far as I can tell, Covie is definitely ovie everywhere except for airplanes and airports, and, from what I hear, hospitals.

item.description: @coachmike66 @gruber @daringfireball Sarcasm is addictive. One can be against something and find it to be a habit that’s hard to shake at the same time.
item.source:markdown: @coachmike66 @gruber @daringfireball Sarcasm is addictive. One can be against something and find it to be a habit that’s hard to shake at the same time.
